title: Drawing, "Agamemnon Refuses to Liberate Chryseis; Minerva Appears to Achilles; The Abduction of Briseis: Galerie d'Iliad, Palazzo Milzetti, Faenza", 1802–05
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and gray-brown wash over traces of graphite on white laid paper
markings: Watermarks: two letters, probably E and C, flanking a motif
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite above each drawing, upper right: crise sacerdote d apollo/ 1; center right: disputa d achille con Agamemnone/ 2; lower right: Agamemnone piglia Briseide a Achille/ 3; light source symbol in grahite at upper rightof each drawing
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: In upper drawing, kneeling priest and companions at left; Agamemnon stands with two captive girls at right with ship in background. In center drawing, Achilles calmed by Minerva while draws his sword. In lower drawing, Achilles seated at left while Patroclus asks Briseis to follow two messengers of Agamemnon.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Agamemnon Refuses to Liberate Chryseis; Minerva Appears to Achilles; The Abduction of Briseis: Galerie d'Iliad, Palazzo Milzetti, Faenza", 1802–05.
1802–05. Pen and brown ink, brush and gray-brown wash over traces of graphite on white laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3327.
